title.value: Spiral volumetric optoacoustic tomography of reduced oxygen saturation in the spinal cord of M83 mouse model of Parkinson’s disease
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the document and reflects the central focus of the study, which involves using spiral volumetric optoacoustic tomography to investigate oxygen saturation in the spinal cord of an animal model for Parkinson’s disease.
title.quote: Spiral volumetric optoacoustic tomography of reduced oxygen saturation in the spinal cord of M83 mouse model of Parkinson’s disease

extractions.description: This paper presents a study on Parkinson’s disease using a mouse model (M83), employing spiral volumetric optoacoustic tomography (SVOT) to assess oxygen levels in the spinal cord. The study highlights the use of deep learning tools for segmentation in MRI data and finds reduced oxygen saturation, without structural changes, indicating potential implications for early disease detection and monitoring.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical research where in vivo experiments are conducted using the M83 mouse model, employing imaging techniques to gather data on oxygen saturation and spinal cord structure in Parkinson’s disease.
type.quote: In vivo spiral volumetric optoacoustic tomography (SVOT) was performed to assess oxygen saturation (sO 2 ) in the spinal cords of M83 mice and non-transgenic littermates.

name.justification: The study heavily involves imaging techniques, specifically spiral volumetric optoacoustic tomography and MRI, to investigate biological processes in a disease model, aligning it with the field of Medical Imaging.
name.quote: We developed tools for deep-learning-based analysis for the segmentation of mouse spinal cord structural MRI data, and volumetric analysis of sO 2SVOT data.

name.justification: The paper discusses the development and use of deep learning models for automatic segmentation in MRI data, indicating an emphasis on this technology in the research.
name.quote: 3D SVOT analysis and deep learning-based automatic segmentation of T1w MRI data for the mouse spinal cord were developed for quantification.

name.justification: The paper specifies the use of a 3D nnUNet architecture for deep learning-based segmentation, indicating this as a key model in their methodology.
name.quote: an in-house deep learning-based model, based on a 3D nnUNet architecture, for automatic segmentation and quantification of mouse spinal T1w MR data.

is_contributed.justification: The model was specifically developed as part of the study for segmentation tasks, indicating it as a contribution from the research.
is_contributed.quote: an in-house deep learning-based model...Deep learning-based model trained on manually annotated slices and improved by active learning.

is_executed.justification: The model was actively used for processing MRI data, indicating its execution in the scope of the study.
is_executed.quote: The GM and WM in the spinal cord were automatically segmented using an in-house developed deep learning-based model.

is_compared.justification: There is no mention of numerical comparisons with other models in the paper, suggesting the focus was on applying the model within the experiment's scope.
is_compared.quote: The model, which is based on a 3D nnUNet architecture, takes as input a 3D MR image and outputs a 3D segmentation file...

referenced_paper_title.value: nnU-Net: a self-configuring method for deep learning-based biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper explicitly references this title in the context of the nnUNet model, supporting its foundational role in the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The model, which is based on a 3D nnUNet architecture [53]...

name.justification: The paper utilizes a specific dataset from the M83 mouse model, which is a standard in this field for studying Parkinson's disease.
name.quote: We used the M83 PD mouse model (hetero- and homozygous), which overexpresses the mutated A53T α-syn form, 9–12 months of age)

referenced_paper_title.value: Neuronal alpha-synucleinopathy with severe movement disorder in mice expressing A53T human alpha-synuclein
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper cites this as a foundational work for the M83 mouse model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The brain histopathology and development of behavioral abnormalities have been well characterized in the transgenic M83 PD mouse model [41].

name.justification: The paper mentions using ITK-SNAP software for examining and reorienting MRI images, indicating it as a tool used in their methodological approach.
name.quote: ITK-SNAP software (v4.0.1, Penn Image Computing and Science Laboratory - PICSL, University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA) was used to inspect and manually reorient the MR images of the spinal cord.

referenced_paper_title.value: SCT: spinal cord toolbox, an open-source software for processing spinal cord MRI data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is a referenced tool for MRI data processing, indicating its mentioned support role in the research context.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ITK-SNAP software...was used to inspect and manually reorient the MR images of the spinal cord. By using an anatomical atlas [47]...
